response.answer_text: Apple’s x86 processors are designed and manufactured by Intel. This includes the MacBook Air, MacBook Pros, iMac, Mac Mini, iMacPro, and Mac Pro. Apple designs its own ARM processors for its iPads and iPhones, and has TSMC manufacture it for them. Though in the past Apple had Samsung manufacture it for them and probably still do for some of their older devices.

The A series Apple designed chips that power iPhones have long been made by two companies, Samsung, and TSMC (Taiwan Semi-Conductor Manufacturing Company). Recently, though Apple have been moving towards TSMC as the sole supplier as they are able to manufacture more precise processors than Samsung. Currently, all Macs use Intel CPUs. Watch processors, S-series and audio device processors W-Series are also produced by TSMC.
